rolls.title: Royal Guard Morale Speech
rolls.context: Juan II addresses the royal guard to inspire personal loyalty. He gives a speech invoking religious duty and promising better equipment.
rolls.outcome_detail: The speech neither inspires special loyalty nor alienates the guards. They remain professional but not personally devoted. The king is reminded he has much to learn about leadership.
rolls.evaluation: Despite favorable conditions (royal authority, new equipment promised, religious framing), the delivery fell flat. The guards remain dutiful but uninspired.

rolls.title: Infantes Revolt During Pilgrimage
rolls.context: After successfully negotiating with the Infantes and establishing a regency council, Juan II rolls to see if the Infantes revolt during his absence on pilgrimage.
rolls.outcome_detail: Despite careful planning and giving the Infantes real power through a regency council, the dice decree that a revolt WILL take place during Juan's pilgrimage. The how and why will be determined later.
rolls.evaluation: The GM assessed 70-75% probability of no revolt. The dice overruled the careful diplomacy. This sets up the central crisis of the early game.
success_factors: Infantes have a bloodless path to power through the council

failure_factors: Noble ambitions may exceed council powers
